intro: Nolana mariarosae, commonly known as the Maria Rosae nolana, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of central Chile. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has a compact, shrub-like growth habit with hairy stems and leaves that are typically narrow and lance-shaped. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
